;The distance from Handan to Gaoping is about five hundred miles. A country, just within these five hundred miles, has staged the ups and downs of its national destiny from rise to decline, from glory to annihilation. Sometimes, history can not only be examined with time, but also measured with space...

;

;Congtai

;

;Climb high and have a bird's eye view, the lake lingers. In early autumn, the leaves of the wood are slightly yellow, and under the morning sun, their slender shadows wade across the lake and fall towards the square tower. The tower and the corridors at both ends are shaped like a giant bow. ——This reminds people of the several-meter-high statue in the square a few hundred meters away, also holding a bow. What's even more interesting is that when I walked into the blue-brick paved terrace, I saw that there was also a statue in the corner of the terrace, depicting the same person, also holding a bow.

;

;This man was once the master of this square tower, this city, and this vast land. He is the founder of the glorious history of Zhao State: King Zhao Wuling.

;

;;

;

;The statue of King Zhao Wuling in Congtai Square, Handan;(Visual China/Photo);

;

; During my visit to the Zhao ruins, I was reminded several times of British scholar John Keegan's conclusion in "History of War": Kings are created by great war horses. Although he is talking about the king of the West, King Zhao Wuling, the Eastern monarch, was also created by war horses. Of course, in addition to the war horse, there is another thing that must be added, and that is the bow in his hand.

;

;Three families were divided into Jin, and Zhao State had the largest territory and was also the most remote. Its main territory is in central and northern Shanxi, northern Henan, and southern Hebei. When talking with Fei Yi, King Wuling of Zhao said, "Today, our country has the river and Boluo River in the east, which is shared with Qi and Zhongshan... From Changshan to Dai and Shangdang, there are the borders of Yan and Donghu in the east, and the borders of Donghu in the west. Bordering Loufan, Qin and Han." - A section of the ancient Zhangshui River in the eastern part of Zhao State bounded by the Yellow River and Boluoshui (; in present-day Hebei Julu;) serves as the border with Qi State and Zhongshan State; from Changshan to Daijun and Shangdang, it borders Yan State and Donghu State to the east, and Loufan, Qin State and South Korea to the west. From this point of view, Zhao was surrounded by the Qi, Zhongshan, Yan, Han, Qin and other princes, as well as the Donghu, Loufan and other tribes. If Daliang, the capital of Wei, is a city with four wars, then Zhao State is even more unfortunate. The entire country is a country with four wars - enemies are eyeing on all sides.

;

;It is not easy to achieve long-term peace and stability with strong enemies around. Especially under the law of the jungle where the strong bullies the weak and the masses bully the mob. King Wuling of Zhao sighed sadly all night long. He said, "Today Zhongshan is in my heart. There are Yan in the north, Hu in the east, Linhu and Loufan in the west. If there are no strong soldiers on the border of Qin and Han, the country will be destroyed. What can I do?" ?"

;

;When you are poor, you want to change. This is the driving force for the princes in the Spring and Autumn and Warring States periods to compete for reform and self-improvement. King Zhao Wuling was no exception. So, there was Hufu riding and shooting.

;

;The boundary between the monsoon area and the non-monsoon area is also the 400 mm equal precipitation line, which runs through the northern border of Zhao State. Zhao State is at the end of agricultural civilization and adjacent to nomadic civilization, especially Dai County of Zhao State. , and even closer to the nomads. The advantage of this proximity is that Zhao can obtain horses more easily than other princes. Before the industrial revolution, horses were mankind's most powerful and reliable source of power.

;

;The disadvantages are also obvious. Once the climate becomes dry and the pastures wither, it will be difficult for the nomads in non-monsoon areas to survive, and they will have no choice but to go south to plunder. At the beginning of the founding of Zhao State, it often faced intrusions from Donghu and other tribes.

;

;The reforms of King Wuling of Zhao surprised the people at the time - he ordered to learn from these barbarians who often invaded Zhao.

;

;The speed and maneuverability of horses are not only incomparable to humans, but also to chariots. Moreover, in the era of King Zhao Wuling, the early aristocratic competitive chariot battles had evolved into a bloody and cruel life-and-death fight. The bulky chariots and the war ethics of not drumming and not rowing had long been unable to meet the needs of the times. Therefore, the heavy infantry represented by Wei Wuzu of Wei State came to prominence. However, the hoplites marched too slowly and had insufficient impact.

;

;What King Wuling of Zhao thought was that if the soldiers were allowed to ride on flying horses like the Hu people, and shoot and charge on the horses, the mobility and flexibility of the army would be greatly improved.

;

;The biggest problem is that the Chinese clothes are not suitable for riding horses. During the Warring States Period, the clothes of the various vassal states of the Huaxia tribe were generally the same. Today we generally refer to clothes as clothes. At that time, clothes meant upper garments and Shang meant lower garments. There are types of jackets, such as jacket, brown, coat, fur, robe and so on. Shang is a bottom garment, similar to a skirt, and is the same for both men and women. There is another type called Shenyi, which means the clothes and clothes are connected together, which is equivalent to the dress in later generations. ——As you can imagine, whether you are wearing a skirt and robe or a dress, it is really difficult to ride a horse, or even gallop on a horse, and perform various complex and difficult movements.

;

;So, how did the nomads do it? It turns out that their clothes are different from those of the Chinese people. The main features of the Hufu of the nomadic people are a short jacket with narrow sleeves and crotch trousers. The former is convenient for archery and the latter is convenient for horseback riding. In addition, the shoes of the Chinese people are made of cloth, while the shoes of the Hu people are made of leather. Leather boots are naturally more suitable for outdoor sports than cloth shoes.

;

;When King Wuling of Zhao disregarded many objections, including from his own uncle, and vigorously promoted Hufu riding and archery, he was like a magical magician who in the blink of an eye transformed the remote and weak Zhao country. Rising powerfully at a speed that dazzled the princes. The first real cavalry in Chinese history was born. The flying cavalry caused a dimensionality-reducing blow to the cumbersome chariots - from a historical perspective, King Zhao Wuling's Hufu cavalry not only marked China's transition from the era of chariot warfare to the era of cavalry warfare, but also meant that Hufu's It has become the common clothing of Chinese people.

;

;Relying on the cavalry, Zhao conquered the three Hus. "King Lin Hu offered his horse" and "Xiang Zhao Gu took control of Hu and sent his troops." Zhao State's control of Sanhu means that it can continuously obtain war horses, further increasing the strength of the cavalry.

;

;What is particularly important is that after conquering Sanhu, Zhao State annexed Zhongshan, which lay across the middle of Zhao State and blocked Zhao State from the north to the south. In order to destroy Zhongshan, King Wuling of Zhao used troops several times. Zhongshan was weak and Zhao Guo was strong, so Zhongshan had to constantly cede territory to seek peace. After each time of ceding territory and seeking peace, Zhao became stronger and Zhongshan became weaker. Entrusting one's own safety to bribing the enemy would only make the enemy more greedy. A few years later, the Zhao army captured the capital of Zhongshan. The last king of Zhongshan was exiled and Zhongshan died. .

;

;With Zhongshan destroyed, Zhao State has solved its inner problems, and there are no more obstacles in the north and south territories. Moreover, although Zhongshan is weaker than the Seven Kingdoms, it is also a country of thousands of chariots, and Zhao's national power has greatly increased due to this. "Warring States Policy" said: "Zhongshan is five hundred miles away, and Zhao is good at it alone. After his success and fame, he has become a vassal, and no one in the world can harm him."

;

;After rapid expansion, Zhao's territory reached its peak: " It reaches Yan and Dai in the north, and Yunzhong and Jiuyuan in the west." Every inch of territory captured from the enemy echoed with the crisp sound of horse hooves and the long cry of powerful bows. With the cavalry pouring into the enemy formation like a tide as the background, Zhao State ushered in its unprecedented glorious years...

;

;In Handan in early autumn, the wind was a bit cold. In the afternoon, people came and went in Congtai Square, and the tall statue of King Zhao Wuling cast a heavy shadow. Congtai was completed more than two thousand years ago. The Congtai at that time was far larger and more spectacular than the Qing Dynasty building I see now. The main function of Congtai was for King Zhao Wuling to review troops and enjoy singing and dancing. In the pre-Qin Dynasty, when buildings were generally low, tall towers stood on the vast plains, which were symbols of the king's authority.

;

;With millions of people looking up to him, King Zhao Wuling ascended the Congtai step by step. This aloof king becomes even more mysterious and majestic because he is far away from all living beings. When the rapidly expanding territory and invincible cavalry made Zhao the only country among the princes that had the strength to compete with Qin, King Wuling of Zhao, who was looking forward to his glory, looked at the people in the audience who would give him orders at any time. And when the soldiers are stained with blood, their ambition to conquer the world seems to be surging like a spring tide...

;

;;

;

;Handan Ancient Congtai;(visual China/Photo);

;

;Sand Dunes

;

;In 298 BC, in Xianyang, the capital of Qin, King Zhao of Qin, who had reigned for ten years, received an envoy from Zhao.

;

;The envoy’s temperament and speech surprised King Qin Zhao. After the messenger said goodbye, the more he thought about it, the more he felt something was wrong: this was definitely not an ordinary messenger.

;

;King Qin Zhao sent people to investigate and found out that the envoy had returned to Zhao. However, some of the envoy's entourage had not yet had time to leave. After questioning the entourage, their answers surprised King Zhao of Qin and his ministers: the envoy "whose appearance was very majestic and unworthy of a human minister" turned out to be the father-in-law of the State of Zhao.

;

;The so-called father-in-law is Zhao Yong, the former king of Zhao State - later given the posthumous title of Wu Ling and known as King Zhao Wuling in history. The year before, King Zhao Wuling passed the throne to his son Zhao He, calling himself the master father, equivalent to the supreme emperor in later generations.

;

;Why did the father-in-law of Zhao go to Qin in disguise to see the King of Qin?

;

;It turns out that before the annexation of Sanhu and the destruction of Zhongshan, between Zhao and Qin, only a small part of the southwest of Zhao State and the northeastern part of Qin State bordered. If the princes want to attack Qin, they must go west through Hangu Pass in the east of Qin. However, Hangu Pass is easy to defend and difficult to attack. The princes rushed thousands of miles, but they were unable to do anything to Qin who had one man to guard the pass and ten thousand men to open it. As Zhao State occupied Yunzhong and Jiuyuan, the situation quietly changed dramatically: Yunzhong and Jiuyuan were in the north of Qin State, which meant that Zhao army could move from north to south and from the north of Qin State to the south.

;

;This is what King Zhao Wuling envisioned. In order to investigate the national conditions of Qin, he took the risk to go to Qin by pretending to be an envoy from Zhao. Two thousand years later, another emperor who was thousands of miles away also disguised himself like King Wuling of Zhao and went deep into neighboring countries to investigate. This man was Peter of Russia. Emperor. In order to make the backward Russia strong, Peter the Great disguised himself as a sailor and visited various countries in Western Europe.

;

;Before going to Qin, King Wuling of Zhao met with the ministers in the palace and announced that he would pass the throne to his youngest son Zhao He, who was less than ten years old, and Fei Yi would be appointed prime minister. He called himself the father-in-law.

;

;The purpose of King Zhao Wuling's inner Zen is to get rid of the specific domestic government affairs and devote all his energy to the war against Qin. Of course, he had another consideration in doing so: Zhao Zhang, the eldest son of King Zhao Wuling, was now an adult. According to etiquette, Zhao Zhang should be appointed instead of Zhao He. However, because King Wuling of Zhao once doted on Zhao He's biological mother Wu Wa, and Wu Wa had just passed away, the memory of Wu Wa and the love for his youngest son were intertwined in the heart of this passionate king. So, he decided to make Zhao He king. Zhao He was too young, so he hoped to let him enter the role as soon as possible by accommodating him, and teach him how to govern the world while he was still alive.

;

;However, abolishing the elders and establishing young ones caused terrible consequences, and also made the rise of Zhao State like a flash in the pan.

;

;After Zhao Zhang was deposed, King Zhao Wuling named him Lord Anyang, but Zhao Zhang was still resentful of his father's arrangement. Moreover, the courtiers were also divided into two groups, some sympathized with Zhao Zhang and some supported Zhao He. At the critical moment, King Wuling of Zhao made another big mistake: when he saw his eldest son kneeling at the feet of his younger son as a minister, he felt pity for the eldest son's situation, and actually planned to divide the Zhao country in two and let the two The sons each became king. This idea was firmly opposed by Fei Yi and others.

;

;King Zhao Wuling's plan has not been implemented in time, and the conflict between the two parties has reached an irreconcilable point.

;

;The tragedy finally happened in a place called Sand Dune.

;

;Sima Qian wrote about sand dunes three times in "Historical Records". In other words, there have been at least three major historical events in the small place of Sand Dune: first, King Zhou of Shang built the meat forest wine pool; second, Qin Shihuang died of illness during his last tour; third, King Wuling of Zhao and his son committed suicide.

;

;Guangzong is a county under the jurisdiction of Xingtai City, Hebei Province, about 70 kilometers away from Handan City. In Dadai Township, northwest of Guangzong County, there is a pair of towers near the highway. Behind the towers, there are two steles with the words: Sand Dune Platform Ruins. Behind the monument, a fence seals a mound, which is the ruins of the Sand Dune Palace passed down through the ages. From the Shang Dynasty to the Qin Dynasty, although the fate of heaven changed and the emperor changed like a lantern, a palace has always been built here. Nowadays, in the wilderness and wilderness, the grass grows and crows fly, and there is no sign of the palace. Only in the small woods on the side, a group of dirty goats were chewing on the withered grass like wires. The shepherd was sitting on the stone, with the same expressionless face as the goats.

;

;King Zhao Wuling wavered between his two sons, which was an unprecedented disaster for him and his country.

;

;In 295 BC, King Wuling of Zhao held a court meeting in the Sand Dune Palace. Zhao Zhang and his followers launched a mutiny. Fei Yi was killed. Zhao He escaped under the protection of General Gao Xin, and the people who supported Zhao He were well prepared. Gongzi Cheng—Gongzi Cheng was the uncle of King Wuling of Zhao and had firmly opposed Hu Fu’s riding and shooting—rushed troops from Handan and surrounded the Sand Dune Palace.

;

;Seeing that the situation was over, Zhao Zhang fled into the palace, hoping to be protected by his father. However, Gong Zicheng and Li Dui killed Zhao Zhang. At this time, King Wuling of Zhao had lost control of the political situation. Prince Cheng and Li Dui neither dared to kill the king nor withdraw from the siege. Therefore, everyone in the palace was ordered to withdraw, except King Zhao Wuling, who was not allowed to leave the palace.

;

;Lack of food and drink, King Zhao Wuling had to eat young birds raw, and eventually "starved to death in the Sand Dune Palace in more than three months." This heroic hero died in such a useless way in an empty palace in grief and anger. What decayed along with his body was Zhao's domination of the world and its glory like a meteor streaking across.

;

;However, the solid foundation laid by King Zhao Wuling's reforms will continue to support Zhao for a long time. Since Qi and Chu were crippled, Zhao has become the most powerful prince outside Qin. Therefore, the descendants of King Wuling of Zhao can still rely on the legacy of his reforms to continue to deal with Qin: in Xianyang Palace, Lin Xiangru returned the intact jade to Zhao; at the Mianchi meeting, Lin Xiangru broke into Zunzu; outside the city, Zhao She defeated the Qin army—— All of this relies on the strength accumulated by King Zhao Wuling and Hufu since riding and shooting.

;

;However, this strength will gradually decline with the unfaithfulness of future generations and the ebb and flow of the national destiny, until a war breaks out five hundred miles away from Congtai...

; p>;

;Changping

;

;Before going to Gaoping, I watched a video: On a cliff more than 20 meters long and half a meter high, the soil is inlaid with stones, like inlaid with stones. Densely packed human bones.

;

;This kind of horrifying scene is not unfamiliar to Gaoping people at all. Over the years, a heavy rain or an infrastructure construction project may reveal a large number of white human bones. No one knew whose son, whose father, or whose husband they were. People only know that since ancient times, as a battleground for military strategists, Gaoping has buried countless corpses under the loess. Among them, just in the decisive battle between Qin and Zhao, the death toll on both sides may be more than 600,000. Today, the entire permanent population of Gaoping City is only 450,000.

;

;Gaoping, also known as Changping in ancient times. During the Warring States Period, it belonged to South Korea. Among the seven countries, South Korea is the weakest, and it is adjacent to Qin. The sad fate of being beaten is almost destined. Shangdang, to which Gaoping belonged, is now located in Changzhi, Shanxi Province, southwest of Taihang Mountain, east of Taiyue Mountain, and north of Wangwu Mountain. "It is the highest, so it is called Shangdang." The terrain here is high, and it looks condescending to the surroundings. There are four roads in the Taihang Eighth Routes that pass through the lofty mountains. Through it, it leads to the North China Plain in the east, Linfen Basin in the west, Luoyang in the south, and Taiyuan in the north. It has been a battleground for military strategists since ancient times.

;

;In 262 BC, the Qin army captured Yewang (;now Qinyang, Henan;), Shangdang and South Korea The main body was divided and became a lonely enclave. For this reason, South Korea had to agree to cede Shangdang to Qin in exchange for peace. However, the people of Shangdang did not want to be ruled by the tiger and wolf Qin, which was known for its cruelty. Feng Ting, the governor of Shangdang County, sent an envoy to the State of Zhao to request that 17 cities belonging to Shangdang be dedicated to the State of Zhao. The State of Zhao sent troops to defend Shangdang.

;

;The kings and ministers of Zhao had a debate over whether to accept the seventeen cities that fell from the sky. In the end, Zhao He's son Zhao Xiaocheng and King Zhao Dan couldn't refuse such a big temptation. Instigated by Pingyuan Lord Zhao Sheng, he accepted the Shangdang and sent heavy troops to defend it.

;

;Seeing that the Shangdang was already in the bag, he did not expect that the State of Zhao would show up halfway, and the State of Qin would naturally not give up. Moreover, Fan Ju, the prime minister of Qin, believed that the main reason why Qin had captured a large area of ​​Chu's land before and forced troops to attack Daliang and Xinzheng was that Wei and Han were unable to fight back, but still failed to become the king of the world. yield. Therefore, we must occupy Shangdang and then attack the area west of Handan, the capital of Zhao State, to threaten the heart of Zhao State and force Zhao State.

;

;So, one of the most famous battles in Chinese history - the Battle of Changping, broke out.

;

;In Gaoping urban area, the Dan River flows through. Going up the Dan River, north of Gaoping City, there is a small village called Changping. Changping Village is the ancient Changping City. On both sides of the Dan River, the valley is flat, and further away, there are winding peaks on the east and west. In and around this valley, there are many place names that are reminiscent of the tragic battle that determined the fate of the country: Siege, Arrowhead, Baiqitai, Skull Mountain, Lianpotun, Jiangjunling... Find peace and quiet in such places When you visit ancient times, you can feel that history is not just written on the page, but also imprinted on the mountains and rivers.

;

;The armies of Qin and Zhao each built camps along the mountains fifty miles to the left and right of Changping City. The Qin army was led by Wang Lu, and the Zhao army was led by Lian Po. Lian Po believed that the Qin army had high morale and intended to fight quickly. The Zhao army is weak and at a disadvantage, so it is best to build fortifications and hold on. Starting from July 260 BC, after several small confrontations between the two sides, Lian Po made Zhao Jun unable to move out by virtue of the favorable terrain. The Qin army was unable to fight and gradually lost its vigor.

;

;The two armies have been in confrontation for more than two years. The Qin State began to implement counterintuitive tactics. Counterintuitive tactics are a common trick of the Qin State, and they often achieve miraculous results. Qin spies sneaked into the Zhao State and spread rumors. Claiming that the Qin army was really afraid of Zhao Kuo, not Lian Po. King Zhao Xiaocheng was originally dissatisfied with Lian Po's defensive stance and suspected that he was timid. When he heard the rumors, he believed them to be true. As the Qin people hoped, he removed Lian Po, who had experienced hundreds of battles, and replaced him with a paper warrior. Zhao Kuo.

;

;King Qin Zhao was overjoyed to learn that Zhao Guo had changed his general. He immediately sent Bai Qi, known as the God of War, to Changping secretly to replace Wang Lu.

;

;The tragedy is already unstoppable.

;

;After Zhao Kuo took office, he changed the rules of integrity and changed from defensive to offensive. Bai Qi pretended to be defeated and retreated, but then attacked Zhao Jun's supply line from behind and cut Zhao Jun into two unrelated parts - one part was the main force led by Zhao Kuo himself, and the other part was the left behind guarding the camp. Zhao Kuo's return route to the camp was cut off and he was surrounded by the Qin army, so he had to hold on to the spot.

;

;In order to kill the Zhao army, King Qin Zhao ordered a nationwide mobilization - all men over the age of fifteen were recruited into the army. It can be said that for the Battle of Changping, the Qin State almost devoted its entire country's strength to a desperate effort.

;

;Zhao Kuo was besieged and had no supplies. After a month and a half without food, there was even a tragedy in the army where soldiers killed each other and fed on corpses. Zhao Kuo organized elite breakouts several times, but they were all repelled by the Qin army. During the last breakout, Zhao Kuo went into battle in person, but was shot to death by a burst of arrows. The commander-in-chief was killed in battle and the army had been without food for a long time. The Zhao army had no fighting spirit and had to surrender to the Qin army.

;

;The number of Zhao troops who surrendered was as many as 400,000. Bai Qi believed that the Qin State could neither reorganize these Zhao soldiers into the Qin Army nor release them.

;

;The tragic massacre happened like this. Of the more than 400,000 Zhao soldiers, all were killed except for more than 20 young men who were released.

;

;The figure of 400,000 was so huge that later generations doubted whether "Historical Records" had exaggerated. However, the numerous bones discovered continuously in the Gaoping area prove that the massacre actually happened. However, how many people died is an eternal mystery.

;

;In the Changping Battle Memorial Hall, there is a pit of corpses protected by glass. Through the glass, the layers of corpses glowed white. That day, there was no one else in the memorial hall except me. Gazing at the remains of those who died abnormally more than two thousand years ago, I seemed to hear the muffled sound of weapons hitting the flesh, as well as the desperate screams one after another...;

;;

;

;Zhao State Coins from the Warring States Period collected by the Shanghai Museum;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;In the valley more than ten kilometers south of Changping Village, there is a small village named Gukou, which is said to be the place where Bai Qi killed prisoners. It is also known as Killing Valley, Weeping Head, and Province of Injustice Valley. In the village, there is a skull temple, and the Dan River flows slowly in front of the temple. This courtyard-shaped temple was built in the Tang Dynasty. According to historical records, during the reign of Emperor Zhongzong of the Tang Dynasty, Emperor Xuanzong of the Tang Dynasty, who was still driving away from Luzhou, passed by Changping. The mountains of skeletons left behind by the Battle of Changping made him very sad, so he ordered them to be collected and buried, and a temple was built to offer sacrifices. However, the Skull Temple I saw was rebuilt by the Qing Dynasty. In the main hall, Zhao Kuo and his wife are enshrined.

;

;Surprisingly, there is also a small house in the temple, with a red and white sign hanging in front of the door: Roast Tofu House. Roast tofu is a special delicacy in Gaoping, also known as white meat. ——Because they hated Bai Qi for killing hundreds of thousands of Zhao soldiers, the people of Gaoping invented this kind of food: they used tofu as meat, and then mixed the tofu residue with minced garlic and ginger to make a juice, which was used as Bai Qi's brain.

;

;There is also a statue outside the Changping Battle Site Memorial Hall, which is still made of Zhao Kuo. Under the statue, there are eight words: empty talk will harm the country, but hard work will prosper the country. History silently warns future generations with cries, blood, tears and numerous bones. As for whether future generations will really learn the lesson, history has never been able to do anything about it.

;

;;

;

;The old Handan Railway Station was demolished after it was decommissioned in 2018, including the statue of Hu Fu riding a horse and shooting in the square. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;The disastrous defeat in the Battle of Changping was forty-seven years after King Wuling of Zhao was riding and shooting in Hufu ; Thirty-two years after the Battle of Changping, the Qin army captured Handan and Zhao died. At that time, no matter the high spirits of the military parade in Congtai, the desperate sigh of being trapped in the sand dunes, or the national mourning of the tragic defeat in Changping, they had all turned into smoke and smoke. The State of Zhao has also gone through its more than 170 years of ups and downs, and has been lost in the turbulent river of time...

;October 1 In the evening, at the men's long jump final of the Hangzhou Asian Games, Wang Jianan was the last to appear. Everything was ready. He clapped his hands as if to cheer himself up, and there were cheers on the field. After a moment, he took a few steps back, started running, accelerated, got on the board, jumped, and landed.

;

;The first jump was 8.22 meters, which was very close to his own Asian Games record.

;

;The second jump was 8.15 meters; the third jump was 8.06 meters. The first three jumps all exceeded 8 meters, showing stable performance. Wang Jianan voluntarily gave up on the fourth jump to accumulate energy for the next two jumps, but the fifth and sixth jumps were not scored due to fouls. With his excellent performance in the first jump, he won the Asian Games championship.

;

;In this Asian Games competition, Wang Jianan continued his distinctive personal style: good results often appear in the first few jumps. In the qualifying round the day before, Wang Jianan was still recovering due to an injury to his front foot. He only jumped 1 jump in the qualifying round and advanced with a score of 7.76 meters.

;

;In the interview after winning the gold medal, he said frankly: "Coming here as the defending champion is quite stressful. I have never defended my title before. Last time in Budapest, as the defending champion, my performance was average. So this time I really hope to win the Asian Games gold medal, but I am also afraid that this gold medal will put too much pressure on myself, so I have been adjusting myself."

;

;On August 25, more than a month ago, At the 2023 World Championships in Budapest, Wang Jianan jumped 8.05 meters in the first jump in the final, but he failed to exceed this score in five subsequent attempts. He failed to defend his title and unfortunately missed the podium.

;

;Long jump tests explosive power, and the victory is decided in seconds. Behind it is the athletes’ years of training and hard work. Ups and downs are normal. What is difficult is to have the confidence to face success, and even more to have the courage to face failure.

;

;;

;

;On October 1, 2023, Chinese player Wang Jianan competed ;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);;

;;Genius boy, a blockbuster;

;

;Wang Jianan is a typical "genius boy". He was discovered to have talent in track and field sports when he was very young. He was born in Shenyang, Liaoning Province in August 1996. He participated in the Shenhe District Games in 2005. Although his performance in the 100-meter dash was average, he was spotted by Yang Keqiang, the coach of the Shenyang Sports School. Coach Yang saw Wang Jianan walking on the playground and found that although he was not very tall, he had long legs and a "bumpy" walk. "He has the energy of an athlete, and I feel like he is a good prospect." At that time. Wang Jianan is still in primary school.

;

;Later, he lived up to the expectations of his enlightenment coach. Yang Keqiang commented that he "trains very hard, is very smart, and has strong comprehension ability. Many technical moves can be adjusted after a few times."

;

;At first, Wang Jianan was not a long jumper, but a decathlete, and his best event was the pole vault. At the age of 14, Wang Jianan entered the Xuzhou track and field team; at the age of 16, he was selected by the Jiangsu Provincial Sports Team to represent Jiangsu Province in the national indoor men's decathlon competition, scoring 7063 points. This is the second best result among world youth athletes in 2012: long jump 7.80 meters, 100 meters run 10 seconds 88, pole vault breakthrough 5 meters, high jump 1.94 meters - this was called a "decathlon genius" at the time ".

;

;Wang Jianan jumped 8 meters for the first time at the age of 16. He won the national long jump championship with a score of 8.04 meters. You know, this is a result that can only be achieved by a veteran who has been training for many years. Chinese men's long jump has been seeking breakthroughs since it broke the 8-meter mark in the early 1980s. However, most athletes have not made a splash on the international stage. Their best results were achieved in domestic or Asian competitions until Players such as Li Jinzhe began to appear on the international stage.

;

;This also allowed Wang Jianan to focus on long jump in early 2013 and was selected for the national team. "I switched to long jump because of my love for track and field. I am a decathlete athlete, and I still love all track and field events. I always have a kind of self-confidence: I feel that no matter what I practice, it will not be a problem. I am not an ordinary person. , I can do it." He said.

;

;As a "genius long jump boy" Wang Jianan, his journey has indeed been relatively smooth. Some people call him "lucky," and he doesn't shy away from it. He felt, "From winning the bronze medal at home in 2015 to creating the best ranking in history at the 2016 Rio Olympics, strength is the foundation, but my luck is better."

;

;In July 2013, in Pudong, India At the Asian Championships held there, in the absence of China's "first brother" Li Jinzhe in the long jump, 17-year-old Wang Jianan won the long jump championship with a time of 7.95 meters. He had never even participated in the World Youth Championships. Qualification for the World Championships in Moscow.  

;

;On July 24, 2014, Wang Jianan, who was under 18 years old, became a blockbuster in Eugene, USA. He won the men's long jump championship at the World Youth Athletics Championships with a time of 8.08 meters.

;

;At the 2015 Beijing World Athletics Championships, at the Bird's Nest competition, three players of the Chinese men's long jump team, Li Jinzhe, Gao Xinglong, and Wang Jianan, appeared in the final at the same time. At that time, someone exclaimed, "The best era for China's long jump It's already here." 19-year-old Wang Jianan won the long jump bronze medal, becoming the first Chinese and Asian athlete to reach the men's long jump podium at the World Championships.

;

;But this also puts pressure on Wang Jianan. "To be honest, after winning that medal, my confidence did not increase significantly, but it put more pressure on me. This medal is the only Asian medal in 32 years, and I won it, and It was a score of 8.18 meters, neither high nor low. Did I think this score was convincing at the time? This led to my results in 2016 being not particularly good throughout the whole year. I felt that I was suppressed by the bronze medal. ." In an interview with CCTV, he admitted that he was carrying a burden.

;

;In the 2018 National Track and Field Championships and Asian Games Trials, Wang Jianan jumped 8.47 meters, which not only tied the men's long jump national record held by Li Jinzhe, but was also Wang Jianan's personal best. In the men's long jump track and field finals of the 2018 Jakarta Asian Games, Wang Jianan won the gold medal with an Asian Games record-breaking performance of 8.24 meters.

;

;;

;

;On October 1, 2023, in the men's long jump final of the track and field event in Hangzhou Asian Games, Chinese player Wang Jianan won the gold medal with a time of 8.22 meters;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;;Hibernating after failure, reaching the top again;

;

;Behind the smooth journey, there are injuries , there are also upcoming surprises.

;

;After the 2016 Rio Olympics and the 2017 National Games, Wang Jianan underwent two knee surgeries on his left and right knees. When he learned that he had torn his meniscus, he even "didn't want to practice anymore and wanted to retire." He took anti-inflammatory drugs for more than a month before he began to gradually improve.

;

;The next major blow to his career was his failure to compete in the Tokyo Olympics. At that time, Wang Jianan had high hopes and was the only athlete in the jumping department of the national track and field team with a medal mission. Although he got a spot to go to the Tokyo Olympics, he did not perform well due to running-in problems with his coach and great pressure. He only jumped 7.81 meters and missed the finals. "It was also a big blow to me. I feel that all the problems arise from my own problems." He took all the responsibility on himself.

;

;This blow did not defeat him. He summed up his experience, regained his confidence and prepared to fight again. "How much worse could it be?" he recalled that time.

;

;The next step was his "amazing jump" at the World Championships in Eugene, which made more people remember this Chinese face. Before heading to the World Championships in Eugene, Wang Jianan shared a calendar on his mobile app on social media: "It has been 3,078 days since I joined the national team, 2,058 days have passed since the 2016 Olympics long jump final, and my first meniscus surgery has passed. 1928 days, 1565 days have passed since the second meniscus surgery..."

;

;This time, Wang Jianan did not continue his past style. Until the last jump, his score of 8.03 meters was only ranked second. fifth place. On the big screen showing the results, the third place score was 8.15 meters. "It's not very high. I think I should be able to sprint. Even if I jump with my head up, I can win a medal."

;

; On July 17, 2022, after the last jump, he glided perfectly in the air and landed. He looked back at the sand pit and felt confident. When he saw the score of 8.36 meters displayed on the big screen in the arena, Wang Jianan squatted on the ground, covered his face and cried.

;

;;

;

;On July 16, 2022, Wang Jianan won China's first ever World Championships men's long jump gold medal at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon, and became the first man in history to win a World Championships. The Asian athlete who won the long jump championship ;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;In the end, 25-year-old Wang Jianan won the men's long jump final at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon With his final "shattering leap", he broke the Asian record and won the championship. He became the first Chinese male athlete to win the field championship at the World Athletics Championships. He was also the fourth Chinese male athlete to win the field event after Liu Xiang, Wang Hao and Chen Ding. The Chinese male athlete who won the gold medal at the World Athletics Championships.

;

;Wang Jianan, who became famous in one battle, will have to face how to surpass himself and break the world record, but this is not easy.

;

;Lewis, a world-famous athlete and American track and field athlete, once forwarded an article on a social platform called "Why is the world record for the long jump so difficult to break?" The article mentioned: In 1968, Beamon set a long jump of 8.90 meters. World record, if Powell had not broken the world record with a score of 8.95 meters in 1991, then no one could come close to Beamon's score of 8.90 meters in 1968.

;

;;

;

;On August 24, 2023, in the men's long jump final of the 2023 World Athletics Championships in Budapest, Hungary, Chinese player Wang Jianan won fifth place;(Xinhua News Agency/Photo);

;

;In the past 84 years, the world record for long jump has only been held by three people. Jesse Owens held it for 25 years, and Bob Bee Mon lasted 23 years and Mike Powell lasted 31 years.

;

;In the recent World Championships in Budapest, Wang Jianan ranked fifth, and at the Hangzhou Asian Games, he finally successfully defended his title.

;

;After the game, he mentioned, "The result of 8.22 meters may be a little bit lower than my competition goal. Originally, I wanted to break my own competition record, but I was still 2 centimeters short. Next, I will still To find problems in the competition, the results of the World Championships in Budapest were not very satisfactory, and it also taught me a lesson. I hope to apply the experience of the World Championships in Budapest and the Asian Games to the Paris Olympics, so that I can achieve a relatively good result. ."

;

;"Hardships will make you successful." He once said that he has always believed in this sentence, from the failure of the Tokyo Olympics to the leap to create an Asian record, and then to the successful defense of the Hangzhou Asian Games. , along the way, Wang Jianan himself is the best confirmation of this sentence.

;

;Recently, the Market Supervision and Administration Bureau in a place in Sichuan issued a warning, strictly prohibiting profit-making activities such as buying fakes based on known fakes. Consumers make complaints and reports. The announcement stated that once a complaint is determined to be malicious, the Municipal Supervision Bureau will not accept it. At the same time, if the complaint is used for extortion, threats and intimidation, the complaint will be transferred to the police to investigate the criminal responsibility of the malicious complaint reporter. Not surprisingly, this "letter of caution" caused great controversy. The bureau later deleted the document from its social media accounts.

;

;This is not the first time such an announcement has appeared. In recent years, many places across the country have issued similar announcements. The municipal supervision department stated that its purpose is to "create safe and comfortable consumption and a good business environment" and "equally protect the legitimate rights and interests of consumers and business entities." However, it is the legal duty of the municipal supervisory department to supervise illegal goods such as counterfeit and shoddy goods. If "knowing about fakes and buying fakes" is considered a malicious complaint and refused to be accepted, it is suspected of neglecting the performance of duties and administrative inaction.

;

;"Profit-making anti-counterfeiting" is also commonly known as "professional anti-counterfeiting". Its legal basis is mainly the relevant provisions of the Consumer Rights Protection Law, Food Safety Law, and Drug Administration Law. The Consumer Protection Law stipulates that if an operator commits fraud in providing goods or services, in addition to compensating the losses suffered by consumers, the amount of compensation should also be increased by three times the price of the goods or service fees. If the amount is less than 500 yuan, the compensation shall be 500 yuan, that is, " If you give a false one, you will lose three." The Food Safety Law and the Drug Administration Law stipulate that if you produce food, counterfeit drugs, or inferior drugs that do not meet food safety standards, or you sell and use food that you know are not in compliance with food safety standards, or you know that they are counterfeit or inferior drugs, you are "counterfeit." "Ten for one", the minimum is 1,000 yuan.

;

;Based on these legal provisions, a group of "professional anti-counterfeiters" were born. They look for substandard goods, food and medicines in the market, and after purchasing them, they complain or sue in order to obtain three or ten times the price. Additional compensation.

;

;Cracking down on counterfeit and shoddy goods and maintaining food and drug safety are the legal responsibilities of market supervision departments. However, the market is very huge, and it is difficult to detect all illegal activities solely relying on the power of market supervision departments. The purpose of punitive damages stipulated in the law is not only to protect the interests of consumers, but more importantly, to make the criminals who make and sell counterfeit goods pay a greater price through punitive damages, so as to curb the behavior of counterfeiting and counterfeiting. With the incentive of punitive damages, professional anti-counterfeiters also have greater incentives to discover counterfeit and shoddy goods and report them to regulatory authorities. In this sense, professional anti-counterfeiters are actually helpers to regulatory authorities. It is much more efficient to discover illegal activities through the clues they provide than it is for the regulatory authorities to find the needle in the haystack on their own.

;

;Of course, there are indeed some people who actually engage in extortion in the name of fighting counterfeiting. For example, some people frame the situation first and then "crack down on counterfeiting", placing expired food taken away in supermarkets and framing merchants for selling expired food. Some people deliberately hide the food that is about to expire in the supermarket. The supermarket fails to find out that it has not been collected in time. They wait until it has expired and then buy it, claiming for selling expired food. Some even failed to find problematic products and threatened merchants with reports to pay "consultancy fees." These actions are no longer a crackdown on counterfeiting, but a "black crackdown", which is illegal and criminal. It is necessary to crack down on these "black crackdowns". However, for the majority of professional anti-counterfeiters who legitimately exercise their rights conferred by the law and demand compensation in accordance with the law, the regulatory authorities simply refuse to accept their reports and complaints because their anti-counterfeiting behavior is "profit-making". There is no legal basis and they are suspected of neglecting to fulfill statutory obligations. Responsibilities may encourage the trend of counterfeiting and selling.

;

;The criteria for regulatory authorities to identify "malicious complaints" include purchasing the same product again after receiving punitive damages and then complaining. But if substandard goods are completely removed from the market after being discovered for the first time, how can professional counterfeiters buy the same substandard goods again? If you continue to sell substandard goods after being punished for the first time, but the regulatory authorities no longer accept subsequent complaints, will the counterfeit merchants be able to continue selling fake goods unscrupulously? Do such regulations protect consumers or counterfeiters?

;

;It is worth noting that, at least in the field of food and drugs, the judicial system supports "knowing about fakes and buying fakes." The Judicial Interpretation "Provisions on Several Issues Concerning the Application of Law in the Trial of Food and Drug Dispute Cases" issued by the Supreme People's Court in 2013 clearly states that for food and drug quality disputes, producers and sellers of food and drugs with quality problems shall use the consumer's knowledge to purchase fake products. If the defense is false, the court will not support it. That is to say, we support consumers to “know fakes and buy fakes.”

;

;As a government department, the Market Supervision Bureau prohibits "knowing about fakes and buying fakes" and considers it "malicious", which is contrary to the regulations of the judicial organs. Once the counterfeiters are sued for administrative inaction, they will be sued in court. I'm afraid it's inevitable that I'll lose. According to the "Rule of Law Daily" report, a professional anti-counterfeiter once reported that many units in Guizhou, Yunnan and other provinces were selling counterfeit medicines. After the market supervision department verified it, they found that he was not buying for consumption purposes and was seeking improper benefits. He was refused a reward and he filed a lawsuit. The court ruled that the municipal supervisory department lost the lawsuit and he should be rewarded.

;

;Unscrupulous merchants selling counterfeit goods not only harm the interests of consumers, but also harm the interests of legitimate merchants. To "optimize the business environment" and "protect the interests of business entities", we should crack down on extortion of enterprises and protect the interests of legitimate business entities. If there is a blanket ban on "knowing about fakes and buying fakes", it will only condone "knowing about fakes and selling fakes" and objectively protect the interests of unscrupulous businessmen.

;;< span>;Who is the hidden rock city in China;;

;

;At the 2023 Asian Pet Expo, an anchor broadcast live on the booth. Pictures and texts are irrelevant. Interface News Visual China Picture

;

;After briefly entering the live broadcast room, a domestic beauty brand established for more than two years decided not to enter the show again.

;

;This is both a fame and fortune fair and a place at the forefront of the limelight. The most recent farce was on September 10, 2023, when super anchor Li Jiaqi criticized netizens while selling Huaxizi eyebrow pencil. The turmoil has been postponed to this day, and the Huaxizi brand has become the target of public criticism.

;

;Many people in the industry are re-examining the sales ecology of anchors bringing goods. A brand manager Chu Shi (pseudonym) is also a melon-eater. For her, the high commissions and pit fees required by big anchors are difficult for small brands to resist.

;

;The "last straw" that caused Chu Shi to give up the live broadcast was exactly a live broadcast. The brand invited a top anchor with tens of millions of fans, and the position fee was about 70,000 yuan, with an agreed sales guarantee of 210,000 yuan. They have high expectations and regard it as the "most important event" since its inception.

;

;But in the end, the leading anchor only sold a few thousand yuan, and did not refund the corresponding amount according to the contract. Chu Shi called this incident a "trigger". Although she felt that the business was unhealthy before, she was willing to abide by the rules of the industry. This time she was in the whirlpool and felt chilled: "Given such a high commission, there are still pitfalls. For a bit fee, a brand like ours cannot play like that."

;

;The brand went to the police station to report the crime, and then won the lawsuit through litigation. However, the refunded fees have not yet been received, and the anchor is still active in the live broadcast room.

;

;“So much profit goes to the host”

;

;For this new brand, the first “obstacle” to live broadcast admission sounds humble: identifying the reasons for rejection.

;

;Chu Shi and the others contacted thousands of anchors and bloggers. Chu Shi recalled: “In the first year, we really hoped to increase the brand’s exposure through some experts. I put a lot of effort into promoting it and its popularity. But the result is really not very good.”

;

;Sending products to popular live broadcast rooms is the preferred way for small brands to gain popularity. Data from the live broadcast e-commerce industry blue book released by the China Institute of Metrology and other units show that in the first half of 2023, the sales of live broadcasts on key monitored e-commerce platforms reached 1.27 trillion yuan, with more than 110 million live broadcasts and more than 70 million live products. , the number of active anchors exceeds 2.7 million.

;

;Following the anchor's product selection process, they will communicate with the other party's business personnel and wait for feedback. If there is no feedback, it means it is inappropriate by default. It’s like rushing through the sand, “maybe less than 10% of anchors or business people will reply to us in this link.”    

;

;At first Chu Shi would feel confused, not knowing where he was stuck. Later, the picture gradually became clearer, "In fact, it is not the product at all, but the dissatisfaction with the price or commission."

;

;She found that anchors would focus on promoting the same product in various categories, making it particularly difficult for new products to emerge. The products that were strongly promoted by the anchors were actually the ones for which the brand offered high commissions. “For example, there are several products we know that offer commissions of 60 to 70 points, and they have already sold to the top in that category. ".

;

;70% commission means that if a product sells for 100 yuan, 70 yuan will be given to the anchor. The remaining costs should cover product development, raw materials, packaging materials and other costs, as well as warehousing logistics, site and labor costs.

;

;“We think this business is very unhealthy.” Chu Shi believes that high commissions force costs to be reduced. “So much profit is given to the anchors. They charge such high commissions, but they do not Without creating corresponding social value and providing more jobs, the profits of upstream brands and the supply chain have been reduced. Brands can only continue to reduce costs, and their products will become worse and worse, and the treatment of employees will also be worse. It’s getting worse.”

;

;Four or five years ago, she worked with anchors for beauty brands at the time, with commissions ranging from 20% to 30%. However, the live broadcast ecosystem gradually evolved. “From the year before last to last year, the commissions continued to increase. It’s rising. I don’t think it’s because the anchors are raising the price, it’s because the industry is too complicated, whether it’s beauty or live streaming, it’s all too complicated.”

;

;Beauty is recognized as one of the most popular fields. Nanshan, co-founder of the beauty MCN organization May Beauty, also feels the same way. Although there is a lot of beauty traffic on the platform, there are also a lot of people entering the platform. "I think it started to roll out in 2019 and 2020, and every year it is better than before. I kept curling more and more without stopping."

;

;The price of the volume, the mechanism of the volume, the content of the volume, the capital of the volume... the prices of things of the same quality are constantly falling in the competition, but the commissions for the anchors are gradually increasing. "I think this volume is good in all aspects." , product homogeneity is also very serious, and every price range is full of competitors."

;

;You Wuyang, director of Hangzhou Xijiang New Retail Research Institute and former deputy director of Alibaba Research Institute, told Southern Weekend reporters that taking eyebrow pencils as an example, from the perspective of raw material processing fees, including factory delivery The cost plus tax may be less than 10 yuan. The biggest cost of cosmetics is sales expenses. Previously, this part included marketing and channel expenses, that is, advertising, celebrity endorsements, channel deduction fees, and profits from offline wholesalers and agents. Now, if you sell through live e-commerce, it is a direct retail. The most important ones are traffic fees, advertising fees, anchor commissions for bringing goods, and pit fees. "These fees account for a very high proportion."

;

;You Wuyang pointed out that the biggest problem with the current live broadcast sales system is the trend of low prices. “After the emergence of live broadcast e-commerce, China’s retail market has been turned upside down. Everyone is fighting for low prices. , If a company has no profits, it will have no money to do product research and development and innovation, and bad money may drive out good money.”

;

;Only care about three points: price, commission, and pit fee

;

;Price and gifts are the key points when attracting consumers to place orders in the live broadcast room. At this point, super The head anchor does have a higher say.

;

;Qiao Lei (pseudonym), the person in charge of a domestic brand who once sent products to Li Jiaqi’s live broadcast room, told Southern Weekend reporters that Li Jiaqi’s pit fee one or two years ago was “not expensive,” “about 8. "More than 10,000 yuan", the commission is 30 to 40%, which is almost the same as other anchors. But Li Jiaqi's prices are very low, even at prices the merchant himself has "never sold before." "He doesn't care how much you originally sold them for, he will only tell you 'how much I want to sell them for.'"

;

; "He will demand 'I am the lowest', but he will not tell you openly. He will only tell you a price to see if you can give it." Qiao Lei said that both parties It is also necessary to sign a price guarantee agreement to ensure that there will be no lower prices, including the brand's own live broadcast room.

;

;This condition is almost harsh, but a large number of businesses are still willing to accept it. Even now, there are still small brands that are eager to get into the super live broadcast room and are waiting hard. Lillian (pseudonym) is the person in charge of branding and e-commerce at a start-up company that makes functional skin care products. For her, the road to Li Jiaqi’s live broadcast room has not yet been opened. “I have been following them for half a year, and I still have During the data review stage.”

;

;;

;

;Like Li Jiaqi (first from left) Super anchors will undoubtedly play a key role in the sales of small brands. Visual China Pictures

;

;In comparison, Chu Shi has come into contact with "very few anchors who are truly professional." Brands provide product selling points, and anchors follow the script. "They rarely ask us professional questions about products." , because today’s anchors have too many choices, and merchants of all sizes are waiting for them to deliver products. They don’t know the raw materials, ingredients and functions of the products. What they care about most are three points: How much is the price, how much is the commission, and is there any pit fee?"

;

;Lin Mo (pseudonym), an anchor who has been doing live broadcasts for five years, told Southern Weekend reporters that she would learn about the product information before the live broadcast. Go to the live broadcast room every hour and communicate with the operation about the overall situation. During the live broadcast, consumers are mainly told three pieces of information: how favorable the price of this product is, how easy it is to use, and when and in what scenario it will be needed. If consumers are tempted but are still hesitant, they will emphasize the accompanying gifts and the decreasing inventory, "to force another order."

;

;According to Chu Shi’s observation, this is because the time to explain each product in the live broadcast room is very limited. Within a few minutes, the strength of the discount is reflected in order to impress users and make them purchase. "Use 'Quantity' is the fastest way for them to reflect the value of the product."

;

;Lin Mo has been a brand external anchor for a long time, and has worked with 30 or 40 brands. She is charged by the hour. "Selling more or less all depends on my own professional ethics and KPIs." There is not a lot of pressure on sales.” Recently, she decided to go it alone and collect commissions for selling goods. The more she sold, the more she earned, which gave her a greater sense of urgency.

;

;In addition, the platform will analyze the live broadcast data in real time, display the product placement expenses, sales volume and total sales of the day, and also conduct vertical comparisons. Increasingly intuitive data also tests the ability of anchors.

;

;The game mechanism between brands and anchors

;

;It is not easy to create a super anchor. May Beauty, where Nanshan is located, once failed to become a super anchor.

;

;This MCN organization has incubated more than 60 beauty experts. Nanshan recalled that the company originally “wanted to go towards the top.” At the end of 2021, they tried to support a beauty blogger with more than 10 million fans. At his peak, the blogger could bring in 5 to 6 million yuan in goods per sale. But they soon discovered that the top anchors were "not that easy to do" and it was difficult to obtain "a particularly good mechanism". The frequency of live broadcasts could not be increased, and the commission rate was relatively low. It was very likely that "the work was in vain and no money was made."

;

;One of the keys to being stuck in the top spot is the mechanism, that is, the brand merchants give the anchors product prices, gift configurations, commission sharing or other incentive resources. The differences in the mechanisms obtained by different anchors are obvious. Nanshan compared its own anchors with the leading anchors in the industry. The same shampoo was sold in both live broadcast rooms for 119 yuan for two bottles of 1,000 ml. At the head anchor, those who place orders can get an extra 400 to 500 ml of shampoo, but they may only get 100 to 200 ml.

;

;Sales that exceed brand expectations, make products a hit, have good daily video and live broadcast data, and excellent business negotiation skills can all help anchors get better mechanisms, "If Without a good mechanism, it will be difficult for users to continue paying for it."

;

;But Nanshan also observed that compared with the previous two years, brands have made less and less "sacrifice" in terms of mechanism. "In 2021, brands are more willing to sacrifice some mechanisms for anchors. For example, if he sells it for 119 yuan in his flagship store, he may give 99 yuan to our live broadcast room."

;

;You Wuyang pointed out,品牌方与主播方本质上是博弈关系。品牌此前低价让利，是希望凭借主播带货，将粉丝吸引到自家官网账号，直接关注品牌本身。主播则需要直播间产品保持低价，维护好原有粉丝，抬高身价。

;

;产品在直播间的标价、主播方能拿到的佣金比例、消费者的赠品等，都是博弈重点。在2023年8月，南山他们以18万元的价格谈下一名百万粉丝主播的合作，包含两三条短视频、两条直播预热及一场专场直播，带货五项产品。品牌方的主要诉求是降低佣金、减少赠品。

;

;双方手里拿着机制表，经历两三轮开会探讨，最终选择各退一步。平均佣金从31%左右降到28%，产品从两瓶600毫升119元及150毫升赠品，变成了两瓶128元加300毫升赠品，相当于“128元一下子到手三瓶”。两方对结果都算满意，算下来，两三场直播后，品牌初期投入“就会回来”。

;

;南山提到，部分品牌与主播也产生了新的合作关系，即在产品面世之前，品牌就会让主播参与到产品开发中，品牌方会和主播沟通：“我这个产品你觉得定多少钱合适”“哪些地方还不合适，我要改一改”，双方会拉长合作线。

;

;“因为主播有个特点，他们比较了解消费者，会使整个产业链更好地贴近消费者。”中国社科院财经战略院研究室主任李勇坚指出，品牌与主播之间的深度合作是相对有益的，能够提高供应链的效率，有利于国产品牌快速形成。但需要警惕的是，有的主播可能会利用消费者的信任，进一步压榨消费者，“（要记得）你是代表消费者的利益，帮消费者去找到物美价廉的商品”。

;

;直播依旧是这家MCN机构2023年发力的方向。南山的依据是，消费者的心智已经形成，有日常在直播间买东西的习惯，同时，直播消费行为变得更加理性，除了价格外，也会考虑产品的适用度，“这时候我们通过直播这种形式去'种草'用户，让他进而下单”。

;

;;

;

;2023年5月，杭州一个美妆电商在直播。 Pictures and texts are irrelevant.视觉中国图

;

;直播电商“天花板”在哪？

;

;不同品牌进直播间的目的各异。乔磊称，对于某些大品牌来说，直播只是渠道，他们更看重“种草”效果，而非主播带货量。新品牌、小品牌则有所不同，需要“种草”，亦需“割草”，希望有足够的卖货量，合作费用回本，货品周转率提高。至于他自己，更重要的目的是推广。

;

;效果是显而易见的，李佳琦一场直播，为他们的店铺带来了十几万的访客，“原来的日销是五六万块钱，可能他帮我们直播带货之后，日销到了八九万，影响力在扩大”。

;

;但李勇坚指出，“依赖大厨”是直播电商生态最大的毛病。对于一个新生品牌，讲好品牌故事、做好产品、形成品牌力是最基本的，依赖头部主播去做品牌难度很大，“有个别的（成功）案例，但是这个案例能不能持续，如果没有品牌力、产品力的话，我觉得值得怀疑”。

;

;在他看来，现在直播电商的“天花板”已经出现。他称，电商的基本逻辑是舒展供应链，缩短营销链，“现在突然之间多了一个主播，砍走25%，砍走30%，这个商业逻辑本身就有问题的”。利益分配机制不健全、价格体系混乱、主播之间发展不均衡均是直播生态乱象，由此引发了新的问题，数据流量造假、虚假下单刷单。

;

;对乔磊来说，直播领域的发展已趋于成熟。不论粉丝量是多是少，受众年龄是大是小，所处领域是热是冷，都有相应的竞争者，“其实现在每一个卡位上都有占位的，任何一个垂类赛道基本上都已被覆盖”。

;

;乔磊发现，往日里，每个平台、每位主播都有各自的受众，彼此影响不大，但到了“618”“双十一”这样的大促时期，几个平台的消费者重合率会明显变高，所有带货主播便会被拉至同一竞技场，竞争力的强弱格外明显。 “一到大型促销节点，其实尾部主播的生存空间是很小的，还是以头部主播为主。”

;

;同样，竞争力不强的小品牌也会选择在大促时“躺平”自保，退出激烈战场。莉莉安称，大促期间流量费用都会变高，自家不具备抢流量分市场的能力，会主动避开战火，“一般（大促节）其实我们都不焦虑的，我们就直接摆烂”。

;

;浙江工商大学经济学院教授、浙江省消费促进工作专家委员会委员赵浩兴告诉南方周末记者，目前直播领域生态是不健全的，“一方面拼命压低供应链上游的价格，另一方面又抬高销售价格，取得巨额利润。红利全都聚集在网红头上去了，生态圈的利润分配严重不合理，以后肯定是要打破这种现象”。他建议市场监管部门加强监管力度，希望供应链更加成熟完善，上下游利润分配合理。

;

;他称，目前直播行业已到了转型期，多种类型的垂直产业链直播、工厂直播、专家直播都在发挥更大作用，出现“小而美、小而专精”的特性，这也是“未来2.0版直播”的发展方向。

;;2023-10-02 12:00:00;
;

;;

;

;2021年10月29日，许鞍华在上海参加《第一炉香》映后交流活动。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;2021年立冬这天，许鞍华的心情很好，她从北京飞往厦门，打算把这里作为她此次内地之行的最后一站。 2019年5月22日，许鞍华执导的新片《第一炉香》在厦门鼓浪屿开机，两年半之后，她带着电影返回这里。在放映活动现场，有观众悄声对话：“听说这部电影是不是拍得不太好？”

;

;“有讨论是好事。”谈及《第一炉香》的口碑争议，许鞍华的态度很坦然，尽管她的职业生涯曾多次遭遇失败和质疑，但在豆瓣网上，《第一炉香》的评分只有5.6，成为许鞍华从影43年来的最低分。

;

;制片人刘韧告诉南方周末记者：“因为种种原因，《第一炉香》没有首映式，这次导演来厦门，是为了答谢之前拍摄帮助过我们的人，完全是我们自费的。《第一炉香》的口碑争议有着很复杂的原因，这和当下电影行业的宣发规则不无关系。Ann(许鞍华英文名)对此不是不在意，但她还经常为我打气，说没关系，她虽然生气，但不会难过，一定要反击回去，吸取经验继续拍——你看她是对抗型的人，有一颗革命的心。”

;

;“拍《第一炉香》大概率会失败”

;

;“这个项目我做了七年，说起来真是一个漫长的故事。”《第一炉香》制片人刘韧说，“《第一炉香》是我制片的第一个项目，青鸟这家公司是我的老师夏梦（注：香港影星，知名爱国人士）临终前交付我的，她嘱咐我一定要拍好电影，所以我就找了许鞍华导演来拍《第一炉香》。”

;

;张爱玲《第一炉香》的电影改编辗转了几十年。张爱玲生前曾中意影星林黛演绎女主角葛薇龙，后来林黛自杀，此事不了了之。 1980年代，夏梦创办的青鸟电影公司开启了香港和内地合拍片的风潮，投资了《投奔怒海》《自古英雄出少年》《似水流年》三部电影。夏梦也曾考虑购买《第一炉香》的版权，但因为香港电影的制作环境发生了一些变化，夏梦离开了电影圈，这件事又耽搁了下来。 1990年代，《霸王别姬》的出品人徐枫购买了小说的版权，曾经与杨德昌接洽过，因为各种原因也没有拍。直到2014年，当时在上海出版行业工作的刘韧与朋友闲聊，萌生了电影改编张爱玲小说的想法。

;

;在张爱玲众多小说里，刘韧选择了《第一炉香》。经过一番波折，2015年，他从张爱玲版权拥有者宋以朗那里买到了这篇小说五年的改编权，着手寻找自己心仪的导演。 2016年，他得到许鞍华首肯愿意担任该片的监制。 “Ann当时就告诉我改编这部电影的难度，改编《第一炉香》大概率是失败，她建议我找一位年轻导演来拍。因为拍这部电影即使拍不好有争议，但年轻人有年轻人的视角，有争议也是好事。”刘韧告诉南方周末记者。

;

;从2016年到2019年，刘韧一直在为电影开拍做着各项工作，遭遇过各种意外和不顺利，眼看着改编版权快要到期了，资方提出请许鞍华担任导演。当时，许鞍华刚刚完成电影《明月几时有》，她对比了手头的几个工作邀约，最终决定承担这部影片的导演工作，她找来了曾和自己在舞台剧《金锁记》有过合作的作家王安忆担任编剧，电影《第一炉香》的雏形渐渐形成。

;

;许鞍华出生于1947年，2021年10月《第一炉香》上映的时候，她已经74岁了。新冠疫情暴发的2020年，许鞍华做完了这部电影的后期，得知威尼斯电影节要将终身成就奖颁发给自己的消息。她是全球首位获得这个荣誉的女性导演，这被看做全球女性电影工作者的胜利。许鞍华在领奖时用英文发表了演说，表示自己回去要帮助更多的年轻人，让他们将来也有机会获得终身成就奖。

;

;2020年10月，一部记录许鞍华从影40年的纪录片《好好拍电影》在香港国际电影节首映，这部作品的导演文念中曾担任过许鞍华几部电影的美术指导，以朋友和合作者的视角为观众展现了晚年许鞍华生活的一些片段。

;

;许鞍华一生未婚，情感经验几乎是空白，她曾说“电影是自己的老公或老婆，文学是自己的情妇”。她眼里只有电影，工作时因为太投入常常会摔倒，最焦虑的事情是没有电影可以拍。

;

;刘韧告诉南方周末记者：“我们在鼓浪屿拍摄的时候，有一天Ann在浴室摔倒了，因为是后脑勺着地，很吓人。她恢复意识后第一时间给我发消息说，'小刘，我摔倒了，我不敢动，你能不能来看看我？'我赶去一看，她后脑勺到脖子那里全是青紫的淤血，赶紧带她去做核磁共振，她和我说，脑子里第一时间考虑的是如果真的出了事，赶紧叫阿关（导演关锦鹏）来（代替她）。Ann真的是一个为了电影拼命的人，以至于很多时候我都忘记她是一位七十多岁的老人了，接下来我们会继续合作，我希望她在80岁之前还能再拍两部电影。”

;

;2021年11月6日，电影《第一炉香》在一片差评中票房还是超过6000万元人民币，有望成为许鞍华内地票房第二名的作品。第二天上午，南方周末记者在厦门对许鞍华进行了专访。谈到最后，她突然说：“我也问你一个问题吧，说实话，你觉得《第一炉香》到底怎么样？”

;

;;

;

;许鞍华根据张爱玲同名小说改编的电影《半生缘》(1997)，梅艳芳(右)和王志文(左)参演。 ;（资料图/图）;

;

;“张爱玲已经变成一个不可侵犯的作家”

;

;;南方周末：;;《第一炉香》这次在网络上遭到这么多批评，说实话我是有些意外的，从豆瓣网的评分来看，这是你职业生涯里口碑最差的一部。我很想知道，你是怎么看待《第一炉香》这次的口碑争议的？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我也没想到会有这么大的声量，但是我觉得这个戏如果得不到好评，能有争议也是好的。大家可以公开谈论自己对电影的观念、一起讨论这个戏，就很好。另外一些社会性的议题，多谈谈也是好的，可能因为疫情的原因，大家都有点无所适从，正好也可以借此机会厘清一些基本概念。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;我看过一些访谈，你说在拍了《倾城之恋》《半生缘》之后，不想再拍张爱玲作品改编的电影了，可为何还会接拍《第一炉香》？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我不是不想拍张爱玲，其实我很想拍，但确实我没有想到怎么拍张爱玲的作品才能让观众接受，或者说怎么拍才能让人感觉电影的艺术性更上一层楼。经过前两部电影积累的拍摄经验，我意识到改编张爱玲作品是很难讨好的，既无法讨好西方（的观众），也不容易讨好中国（的观众）。实话实说，《半生缘》就被威尼斯电影节拒绝了，他们本来满怀热情请我把这部电影带到威尼斯，看过之后却觉得这是一部很普通的爱情电影。 ;

;

;后来有一次《半生缘》在美国放映，一个很有名的影评人说我们可以把这部电影当成威廉·惠勒（William Wyler，《罗马假日》导演）这类技术型导演拍摄的一个感人的、中规中矩的爱情片。他们以这种眼光看《半生缘》，所以我拍《第一炉香》的时候并非不知道后果。

;

;其实他们分不清，我们克服巨大的困难拍摄的实景和假的有什么区别，也不理解人物的背景，认为这是一部普通的“肥皂剧”。因为他们没有看过张爱玲，我们在原著文本的基础上进行了高难度的改编，做足了工夫，他们也不觉得，认为这样的电影和好莱坞1940年代的电影没有区别。

;

;《第一炉香》和《倾城之恋》都有很长的台词，这些台词在电影里特别不讨好，但是如果没有使用原著里的句子，读者又不会放过我。张爱玲的读者会要求你的作品和原著一样或者更好，可我知道张爱玲笔下的故事很多都不算有创意，因为她的创意在于她的写法，而不是故事本身。

;

;我一直都没有想到该怎么拍才是好的，我没办法将它做成一个小众的艺术片，因为那样是拿不到钱的。这中间我听到过各种反馈，越发意识到市场改变了。何况这些年来，张爱玲已经变成了一个不可侵犯的作家，有很多狂热的书迷，他们对张爱玲比我还熟悉，一点差错都会很麻烦，我是深深知道这些问题的，只是还没想到如何克服。

;

;我拍这样一个故事给现在的“90后”“00后”看，其中的人物关系他们可能是不懂的，他们不知道谁是Uncle，什么是二房，姑妈的身世又是怎么回事，不是他们无知，是他们的经验里面没有这些东西。比如一个女孩，在1940年代的农村，一旦“失身”就是要浸猪笼的。现在不是那回事，女孩贪图舒适的生活也是无可厚非的。那个年代其实特别虚伪，大家不谈钱的，一个女人想要钱也不肯认的。

;

;在这样的情况下，我要把这个故事弄得让年轻观众看得明白、觉得合情合理，同时还要忠于原著，平衡这些是很难的。我不是为了自己拍不好而自辩，我只是想分享我经历过的一些问题。

;

;;南方周末：;;你好像说过《第一炉香》和《倾城之恋》比，你认为是好过后者的？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;对，肯定。以前是整个错了，现在也许是和原著有一些偏离，可我是故意的。我拍《倾城之恋》是希望把它拍成很感人的故事，但其实它应该是最不感人的故事，只是有一个看上去好的结局罢了，这才是张爱玲的创意。但因为我是看很多浪漫小说长大的，就希望男女主人公有种成为“战乱鸳鸯”的感觉，其实都错了，完全违背了原著的精神。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;《第一炉香》从筹备到拍摄的过程里，你觉得难度最大的地方是什么？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;光是找资金已经很困难了，不过不是我找的，是制片人找的，他找了三年。买了版权以后，人家都说《第一炉香》怎么（好），张爱玲怎么（好），但真的要掏钱出来的时候却没人。我不怪他们，因为只要一算，票房很容易算出来的，这是一个文艺片，可能需要庞大的资金，要重现那个时代的景和服装，恐怕很难回本。 ;

;

;我反而觉得选择演员和组拍摄班子不是太大问题，因为张爱玲的号召力，大家都愿意来试试。其次的难度是选择拍摄的地方，这中间也蛮波折的，后来才选择了鼓浪屿，到真正拍摄的时候，因为已经有了这样一个成熟的班子，反而是没有什么问题。

;

;;南方周末：;;你讲到这个片子找钱很难，找演员是相对容易的，但这部电影争议最大的地方反而是演员的选择上，在你找演员的过程里是否受到过资本的干预和介入？比如他们会从票房的角度告诉你应该选谁不应该选谁?;

;

;;许鞍华：;;会有，但都是一些正常的讨论，他们没有给我很大的难处。 ;

;

;;

;

;许鞍华(左)与服装指导和田惠美(中)、制片人刘韧(右)在电影《第一炉香》片场。 ;（受访者供图/图）;

;

;“我已经不再为票房焦虑了”

;

;;南方周末：;;在关于你的纪录片《好好拍电影》里，你很直接地表达了自己每次拍完一部电影都会担心票房，这对你来说是个挺焦虑的事情。综观你的职业生涯，你几乎没有停止过工作，这在香港的电影环境里并不容易。你能不能谈谈自己在不同时期和不同电影公司合作和博弈的过程？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我没有必要很详细地谈以前的困难，而且从《第一炉香》开始，你刚才说的这种焦虑已经不存在了，因为对我来说，判断一部电影成功与否已经不完全是（通过）票房了。上世纪七八十年代，当时的香港（电影）不卖钱可不行，那就找不到下一部的钱。我感觉现在只要能得个奖，有少部分观众觉得特别好，导演名声在外的话还是可以找到投资的。当然，也不是说就一定可以拍到理想中的东西，因为投资方还是要评估这部电影是不是有收益。但我意识到我也不用焦虑了，我焦虑的是怕没戏拍，不是焦虑别人骂或者是不成功，所以这个问题已经不存在了。 ;

;

;回想起来，每一部戏都有不同的困难，如果我说得很细，好像是诉苦，也没有必要。这就是我工作的一部分，不接受就不要做了，老是抱怨没有什么好处的。

;

;;南方周末：;;一般提到你，大家都会想到你拍的那些文艺片，会说你很有社会关怀。其实你也尝试过不少类型电影，比如武侠片、恐怖片，你拍这些是否受到市场的左右？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;《幽灵人间》这样的“鬼片”其实从来都没流行过的，很少人拍的；武打片是曾经流行过，我想拍是因为我是“武侠迷”。我只有很少数的几部电影完全是为了工作，比如拍摄《上海假期》，是因为当时在等下一部电影开拍，有人和我说《上海假期》的导演退出了，问我要不要拍，我看了剧本觉得还不错。我认可一个剧本才会拍，不会不认可就拍的。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;大家总有一个感觉就是香港电影整体的环境都特别商业，类似你拍的《投奔怒海》《千言万语》这样的电影是不够主流的，几乎没有人拍的。 ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;那倒不是，香港其实也有不少导演拍这些的，可是产量不多，我感觉至少也有十几位吧，比如关锦鹏、张婉婷、罗启锐，跟我们同时期的谭家明……其实上世纪七八十年代还是蛮多人拍这种电影的，不是我一个人。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;显然你和他们也有一些差异，比如1982年的《投奔怒海》，你就关注到了越南难民这个题材，当时很少有香港导演去拍香港之外的人和事，这和你的个人经历有关系吗？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;有关系，1978年的时候，我在无线电视台工作，要拍一部写实的剧集《狮子山下》。 ;

;

;我选了拍摄这个题材，就做了好多功课，还跑去难民营。我开始对他们以前在越南的生活产生兴趣，发现很多难民根本就是华人，他们的唐人街和我小时候生活的澳门蛮像的，我对这种地方特别有情感，就想把这些画面拍进电影里。

;

;;南方周末：;;所以你一直都特别关注社会现实？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我很少概念为先的，都是先看到人和事，觉得不错，再慢慢琢磨，最后才会理出一个逻辑，用来回答各种问题。比如要告诉编剧为什么要选择这样的故事，很多都是事后才会考虑的，最初往往就是凭借一时冲动。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;我知道你之所以接拍《第一炉香》，其实和《投奔怒海》也有一些渊源，是因为青鸟这家公司。为什么在当时香港的大环境里，夏梦会投资《投奔怒海》呢？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;这类电影一直是不好找钱的，但夏梦有自己的理想和她强硬的后台，他们拍这部片子完全不想赚钱的，主要是为了拍摄一部有文化感的电影。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;你的电影处女作《疯劫》就获得了成功，拿了金马奖；《投奔怒海》获得了金像奖，当时你都不到35岁，可后来的十年间，你的几部电影又都不是很理想，直到《女人四十》事业才有了起色，这中间你是怎么熬过来的？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我想知道为什么会这样，到底是拍的电影出了问题，还是我自己出了问题，不了解社会跟观众了吗？我其实蛮好奇的，也很想知道到底为什么有些片子不好，所以我就继续拍，能拍就拍。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;今天回过头来看，你有找到这个原因吗？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;有的，其实每一部都不一样。总体来说，1985年到1995年是香港动作片的全盛时代。整个行业里的工作人员习惯那种工作方式了，完全不配合我们这种类似学生作业、半工业化的方式，他们都是同时做好几组的事情。 ;

;

;当时我的心情一直不太好，觉得自己和他们格格不入，工作也没有做好。因为工作人员拍商业片，同时做好几组，他们很累的，我也会觉得整个大环境不支持我拍的这类电影。 1994年以后，这波高潮就结束了，香港的电影工业开始慢下来了，大家差不多就回归到一次一部戏的状态里。

;

;;南方周末：;;在这个过程当中，你没想过转型的问题吗？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我1986年就拍了《书剑恩仇录》，但不成功。 1991年左右拍了《极道追踪》，是一个黑帮片，也不成功。主要是我真的不喜欢拍动作，我跟动作指导合作，交给他就不管了，等到他来给我看，我也不习惯要反复地沟通。其实动作指导在现场指挥，我应该在后面待着，不停地跟他研究怎么拍，但我不是很喜欢这种形式的合作。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;所以到了《女人四十》之后，你才找到什么样的电影是更适合自己的——也许投资不是特别大，但可以保持自己风格的电影？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;对，是这样的。 ;

;

;;

;

;许鞍华根据张爱玲同名小说改编的电影《倾城之恋》(1984)，周润发(右二)和缪骞人(右一)饰演男女主角。 ;（资料图/图）;

;

;“我其实比较像内地导演”

;

;;南方周末：;;你是最早来内地拍戏的香港导演之一，1985年拍《书剑恩仇录》的时候，曾经在内地生活了整整一年。后来你的《半生缘》被看做当时合拍片的一部典范。等到了《玉观音》《黄金时代》等电影，可以说几乎就是内地资本占主要部分了。可你也不像陈可辛等导演那样把重心完全放在内地。或者像徐克，他和你一样都算是“香港新浪潮”的导演，但拍摄《长津湖》这种主旋律电影也得心应手。 ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;对。我觉得1980年代我拍《投奔怒海》和《书剑恩仇录》的时候，内地的电影工业是很落后的。现在相对于香港来说，内地的电影工业变得很发达。比如你走进一家后期公司，它什么都安排好了，非常成熟。 ;

;

;香港商业片的导演和内地导演的思路也不太一样，他们有自己的创意，但完全以市场为焦点的，追求的是好看就行。但内地，就算是商业片导演都还是有一套伦理，想要文以载道，一定要有核心的主题才拍。我其实比较像内地的导演，要有一个主题贯穿在电影里。

;

;;南方周末：;;你在香港大学读的是文学专业，我觉得你是很看重电影里的文学性的，而且你很喜欢在电影里使用一些文学元素，比如《男人四十》里的诗词。我觉得这些元素是你电影里的人物的来处，你的电影和王家卫等导演不同，人物总是有一个来处的，可能是物理意义的来处，也可能是精神意义的，这个来处往往是中国内地。 ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;对，这些可能和我的经历有关，但也不是刻意的，有时候不是我加进去的，比如说《男人四十》里面念古诗的场面都是编剧岸西原创的。 《客途秋恨》里面那是真实的东西，我爷爷教我念诗，也不是我刻意地加的。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;你来内地拍的几部电影努力做着各种探索和尝试，《姨妈的后现代生活》《玉观音》《黄金时代》等等，几乎每一部都有争议。尤其是前两部，因为是现代戏，大家会觉得你不是很懂内地的生活。 ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;有争议是挺好的，的确也存在一些隔膜，比如观众有时候不喜欢配音，有时候不喜欢语言上带着口音，都不一样的。他们很在意台词讲得好不好，但我们广东话其实不太在意这个，讲的自然随便就好，没有所谓抑扬顿挫台词的训练，这是很大的分别。我想未来我可能还会拍内地生活，但要看题材是怎么样的，能拍的当然拍了，只是恐怕比较难，因为完全不知道好多生活细节。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;你从《黄金时代》开始就一直在拍年代戏，是不是这样会更容易规避掉这些文化隔膜的东西？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;对，因为有些时候我不懂网络。尤其是现在这个网络时代，我连衣食住行都不懂，完全不一样了，比如说如何跟人家交往啊，怎么通电话啊，我都不知道了。 ;

;

;“导演是一个年轻人的职业”

;

;;南方周末：;;2020年，你获得了威尼斯电影节的终身成就奖，当时你说未来想把精力放在培养年青一代的电影人身上，未来你在这方面可能会做哪些工作？你们这代导演被叫做“香港新浪潮”，你觉得未来华语地区的年轻导演是否还能形成一股新的浪潮？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;有机会就做吧，我不会刻意去开一个公司，我不善于做这些事。如果有问题大家一起商量就很好啊，但不是真的大展宏图地做。 ;

;

;我讲“新浪潮”讲得太多了，开始有些受不了，其实正好那时候有一些从外国念电影的人回香港，一开始都在电视台工作，刚好差不多时间拍了电影，那时候传统的电影大厂制度有点不知道何去何从了，我们这群人在电视上拍了一些写实的东西，后来也就继续拍下来了。其实不是法国新浪潮这种革新电影历史和语言的想法了，当时也蛮繁荣的，大家都有戏可以拍，都很开心。

;

;其实这些年一直都有不错的年轻人出来，只是可能不叫“新浪潮”，因为没有那么集中。香港还是很小的，从各种影展来看内地导演，一些年轻人拍得很好，坚持几年多拍几部，就会变成中坚分子了，这个跟“香港新浪潮”一样，只不过没有大锣大鼓地这么命名而已，其实你们媒体真的可以多给他们一些曝光。

;

;给年轻人机会是好的，但没必要把帮助青年人挂在嘴里，变成一个没有预设的口号，我感觉年轻人需要的是精神上支持，而不是跑去做一个监制，要是出了问题，是换了对方，还是支持他做一些自己不认同的事情呢？我不想把这件事作为一个全职的事情，因为我不喜欢管人。

;

;;南方周末：;;是不是可以理解为，你在工作里既不想管别人，也不想被人管？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;不是的，拍电影是一个高度合作的工作，怎么能不跟人合作呢？可是我自己有一些标准，有什么是人家不能管的，要不然你白拍了；有些什么是人家能管的，自己知道就行了。 ;

;

;当然也要看具体的情况，比如说真是很想拍某部电影，底线可能会变低，或者反而会高要求。我是保持这个灵活性的，不能一早说了自己一定如何，到时候可能会自打嘴巴的。

;

;;南方周末：;;你已经74岁了，我真的很好奇你是如何保持一直拍电影的状态，你的同辈人甚至一些晚辈，很多都退休了。 ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;我自己都在问这个问题，我在工作的时候没有想过克服什么困难，因为困难是一定的，导演这个行业和自己的灵感以及多想拍有关系。有些人拍得差不多了，就觉得要去赚钱了，或者要改职业了，这恐怕不是因为遭遇了什么挫折。一个人其实很难一生都在拍电影，导演是一个年轻人的职业。超过五十岁，体力就跟不上了，也跟不上时代了。 ;

;

;拍《女人四十》以前，我才四十多岁，就有朋友叫我退休了，但我就是不服气，我也没有什么事情是可以超越拍电影这件事的。当然，我的例子只是个别情况，拿来给人家做一个鼓励，但也许没有什么用，做导演又不能发财，喜欢才可以一直拍。

;

;;南方周末：;;前几年内地电影市场特别繁荣，一些人会产生做了导演就可以获得某些名利的错觉。 ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;没关系，你什么时候停，为了什么去拍，只要自己搞清楚就可以了。我觉得做每件事都需要想清楚为何去做，不是人家如何也跟着去做。做导演最好是能够不断地挑战自己，如果每次都一样，来来去去都是同样的东西，我可能就不会继续拍了。另外，在这个激烈变迁的世界和社会，导演的位置变得很快。 ;

;

;我一直在考虑拍什么人家才会想看，也可能去拍剧集。老实讲，最重要的就是要保持身体健康，没有这个什么都做不了，至于想拍什么，会不会有成就，这些都是不能保证的。

;

;;南方周末：;;说到年龄限制，欧洲和美国年纪很大还在拍的导演并不少，比如克林特·伊斯特伍德(Clint Eastwood)，九十多岁了还在拍电影，但亚洲几乎没有这样的导演，你觉得和文化有关系吗？ ;

;

;;许鞍华：;;当然了。他们团队比较适合年纪大的导演吧，因为分工分得比较细，拍摄制度也比较完善，可能每天就拍6个小时，他们都是有度的，比较容易，不像我们这边这么拼命，但你说的这种现象其实都是非常少数的。 ;

; Mon, 02 Oct 2023 11:25:03 +0800 “互换住房”有没有风险？理解年轻人对人性的乐观、对陌生人的善意丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/258028
;;2023-10-02 10:00:00;
;

;长假漫漫，正宜出行。据文旅部，今年长假期间全国国内旅游出游预计达8.96亿人次，同比增长86%。而2019年长假七天全国共接待国内游客7.82亿人次。今年多一天，也就是说，今年长假日均国内出游人数已经回到2019年的水平。看来，旅游业的复苏是实打实的。

;

;数据显示，长假假期，长三角、珠三角地区像上海、苏州等热门旅游城市的文旅市场异常火爆，酒店、机票等订单量已比去年同期增加了至少5倍，价格也普遍大幅上涨。在长假前夕，有不少网友在社交平台上发布“旅游互换住房”帖子，寻找与自己旅游目的地相反的网友，以互换住房，节约开销。这倒是契合了旅游的本意：旅游，无非是从自己玩厌的地方去别人玩厌的地方，逃离日常生活，寻找有别于日常生活的疏离感与新鲜感。

;

;互换住房，同时段每一方都去对方的城市，住上对方的房子，风险应是可控的，因为每一方至少都知道对方的住址与联系方式等真实信息。 “对等”本来就是一种建立“均势”、控制背信等风险的有效手段。不过，如果双方达成的互换住房约定是：一方先在这个假期去另一方的城市，住另一方的房子，另一方在一段时间后去声索自己的对价，那难免有些风险。

;

;首先是安全风险。哪怕有约定，来入住的一方对你来说是陌生人，你没法核实Ta的身份，Ta可能用假名假身份证，你哪怕不以真实身份示人，你的住址与联系方式等信息总是真的，这就带来了不对称与不对等。对方有恶疾，会损害家人健康；对方有不良卫生习惯，把居住环境搞得很差，不免让人头大。如果对方有意无意搞坏了屋内设施，也是麻烦。

;

;其次有背信风险。只要不是一手交钱一手交货的交易或约定，都有这样的风险，在你履行了约定，好心好意招待了TA，但等到你要去TA所在的城市，TA直接毁约背信，你难有办法维护自己的权益，或者，对方提供的居住条件与其所宣称的相差甚远，大大占了你的便宜，你大概率也只能捏着鼻子忍了。实物互换，又不是同时交付的，货不对板也是常有的事儿。

;

;平台随处可见对“互换特产”的控诉：被对方占便宜了、欺骗了，说到底还是对人性估计不足。古人有“慎独”之说，以此作为一个人是否真讲道德的判断标准，很有道理。不少人的道德是有弹性的：在熟人面前讲道德，因为不讲有后果，会影响声誉；在陌生人面前就不讲了，甚至还会临时起意作恶，因为觉得在谁也不认识自己的地方率性一把也很难被追究。

;

;那么，为了规避上述两种风险，你坚持要核验对方的身份，譬如找可信的第三方来担保，或者预收对方住宿费？这样的话，和做民宿又有什么差别呢？如果想做民宿，把可用的房间挂到OTA平台出售，经过平台这一道筛选，安全风险可控，背信风险全无，岂不更省事？

;

;如果你坚持亲力亲为，其实是在重走Airbnb进化的老路：最早大家只是想要比住酒店省钱，建个平台搭个桥吧，但在经过一段时间的野蛮生长与混沌之后，发现草台班子不行，还是需要专业化与标准化，让专业的人来做专业的事儿，不定型的“非标”服务很难玩得长久，最后Airbnb还不是回到了酒店的模式。聚合的所谓民宿，不过是众多私人开的小规模酒店而已。大规模选秀节目，最终胜出的往往也是专业学音乐或舞蹈的。

;

;话说回来，互换住房，其实就是“沙发客”换了个名称，也自有其生态位。有家有室的人想到上述风险就忍不住皱眉，出门在外宁愿花钱住酒店也不想因为省钱而摊上麻烦，这诚然是不错的。但对刚刚走上工作岗位的年轻人来说，租着一个刚刚可以容身的房子，里面没有贵重物品与设施，身无长物，总之没有钱，因初涉社会还比较小清新，有对人性的乐观与对陌生人的善意，上述风险也不是个事儿，乐意让外地网友来住上一宿几宿，自己去外地也是如此这般，不亦宜乎？

;

;都是年轻人，都穷，都理解要省钱，有共同话题，一个陌生人也许能带给自己一个从前接触不到甚至想象不到的世界，把自己充分暴露于随机性之中，与更多的人接触互动，发现更大更广阔的世界。自己走出去可“行万里路”，别人走进来则是“万里路向你行来”，运动是相对的，变换参考系两者是一回事，自己的经历与别人的经历都一样可增加知见。虽说可能会遇到一些烂人、怪人，但有些能成一辈子的好朋友也是这样认识的，风险可控，有何不可？

;

;年轻人的这种开放心态与分享精神还是难能可贵的。某种程度上，如果遇事想到的全是风险，然后瞻前顾后、畏葸不前，什么也不敢做了，其实是心在变老的体现。所以，大家可以善意提示风险，但也无需用各种风险恫吓年轻人，应该乐见年轻人用好用足这青春时光，这美好恣意的时光是短暂的。我们的身体会衰老，但心态应该尽量保持年轻、锐气勇气不失。
